revised_title: Computational Approach to Structure from Motion Interpretation
tldr: The author examines the computational problems of interpreting structure from motion and proposes a scheme that can infer the three-dimensional structure and motion of objects from two-dimensional projections. The rigidity assumption is introduced to constrain the interpretation and reduce the number of possible solutions. The scheme is applicable to both orthographic and perspective projections, providing a computational approach to understanding the perception of structure from motion.
